recommendations: Carlotta Knapo
Business Relationship Manager at Texas Department of Transportation
October 13, 2016, Carlotta was a client of Abe’s

I’ve known Carlotta for a decade, as she was Intel’s primary contact for the instance of my company’s federated search engine. During that time, she conducted user testing, managed releases, submitted enhancement requests and worked with our project managers to work through issues until they were resolved. Her technical knowledge and friendly, candid disposition made her a joy to work with. I’d hire Carlotta in a heartbeat if Deep Web Technologies had an opening for an experienced professional who can see the big picture, pay attention to detail and deliver results.

Carolina Weibring, SPC4, CSM
Sr Product Owner at CA Technologies
February 4, 2012, Abe was senior to Carolina but didn’t manage directly

Carolina worked for me for the past 4 years as head of our Q/A team. Q/A at Deep Web Technologies is very challenging as our federated search solution is very complex and it is not possible to do comprehensive live tests or the information sources wouldn't appreciate it. Carolina redesigned many of our Q/A procedures, developed lots of automated tests and mentored  junior members of our Q/A team. Carolina is very professional, pays attention to detail and is a joy to work with.

summary: Abe Lederman has 35 years of experience in computer software engineering, the last 25 years focused exclusively on developing leading-edge information retrieval products and solutions. Mr. Lederman began his career as a Software Developer at Hewlett Packard and was recruited in 1987 to become a founding member of Verity, a startup pioneer in the field of text retrieval where he developed the user interface to their Topic product. Verity became one of the first companies to go public at the start of the Dot Com era.In 1994, Abe left Verity to start Innovative Web Applications (IWA), a software consulting firm primarily serving Los Alamos National Laboratory (LANL). At LANL Abe was one of the pioneers in developing web-based search-enabled applications including one of the largest applications at the time that searched 20 million records and contained more than 200 million hyperlinks.Starting in 1998 while consulting with the U.S. Department of Energy’s Office of Scientific and Technical Information (OSTI), Abe developed Federated Search technology that enables searching of hundreds of information sources in parallel.In 2002, in order to exploit the full potential of Federated Search, Abe founded Deep Web Technologies (DWT). As President and CTO Abe has pushed DWT to set the gold standard for Federated Search, pushing the limits of what is possible. Innovations included: incremental display of search results, sophisticated relevance ranking, scalability to searching thousands of sources in parallel and multilingual search.Abe holds Bachelor of Science and Master of Science degrees in Computer Science from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology.
name: Abe Lederman
title: Founder and CTO, Deep Web Technologies
